mdRecord.dcterms:title: Portraits and authograph signatures of the framers and signers of the Declaration of Independence, Philadelphia, July 4th 1776
Declaration centennial, 1776-1876
Portraits and autograph signatures of the framers and signers of the Declaration of Independence
mdRecord.dcterms:contributor: Albert H. Small Declaration of Independence Collection (University of Virginia) [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Individual cameo portraits and facsimile signatures of 50 of the signers of the Declaration, with another 7 signers representated by facsimile signature only. "Declaration 1776" appears in a circle at the upper left; "Centennial 1876" on the right. With insets of the Liberty Bell, the "State House in 1876," a military emblem and "Carpenters Hall, where the first Congress met." [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Removed from acidic mounts. Albert H. Small Deposit, June, 2004. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: United States.--Declaration of Independence--Signers--Portraits
